name: Vietnamese Iced Coffee (Cà Phê Sữa Đá)
description: The most popular coffee drink in Vietnam, Cà Phê Sữa Đá, or Vietnamese iced milk coffee is made from dark-roasted robusta and/or arabica beans and sweetened with rich and creamy condensed milk before being poured over ice. The result is a perfect balance of sweet and bitter flavors that’s perfect for any coffee lover on a hot day.
keywords: Vietnamese iced coffee, Vietnamese iced milk coffee, Vietnamese iced coffee recipe, Vietnamese iced milk coffee recipe, how to make Vietnamese iced coffee, how to make Vietnamese iced, how to make cafe sua da, cafe sua da, Cà Phê Sữa Đá, ca phe sua da cafe sua da recipe, Vietnamese coffee, Vietnamese robusta beans, Vietnamese robusta coffee, Vietnamese arabica coffee, Vietnamese coffee beans, arabica coffee beans, what is the difference between arabica beans and robusta beans, arabica vs robusta coffee beans, popular Vietnamese coffee beans
recipeIngredient: 2 heaping tablespoons Arabica and/or Robusta coffee ground
recipeInstructions: In a short glass, add condensed milk.
Add a phin on top of the glass then add ground coffee into the chamber. Use the tamper to press the coffee grounds down gently and evenly. Twist the tamper to tighten and secure it in place.
Fill the chamber with hot water to the top. Cover with a lid. Let the coffee drip through the filter and into the cup below. This process can take 5-10 minutes.

Coffee is ready once the hot water completely runs through the phin. Remove the lid and use it as a coaster for the phin. Stir to mix coffee with condensed milk until it's completely dissolved then transfer coffee to a tall glass of ice, stir, and enjoy.
